unnormalised: New Delhi: A major fire broke out at a residential building in Sector 44, Noida, UP, 201301, early this morning. Initial reports suggest the fire started around 03:00 AM due to a suspected short circuit.
normalised: New Delhi: A major fire broke out at a residential building in Sector forty four, Noida, U-P, two zero one three zero one, early this morning. Initial reports suggest the fire started around zero three zero zero A-M due to a suspected short circuit.

unnormalised: The building, located at Plot No. 12, Sector 44, is a multi-story apartment complex housing approximately 150 families. Firefighters from the Noida Fire Department responded promptly, arriving at the scene within 15 minutes of the initial call.
normalised: The building, located at Plot Number twelve, Sector forty four, is a multi-story apartment complex housing approximately one hundred and fifty families. Firefighters from the Noida Fire Department responded promptly, arriving at the scene within fifteen minutes of the initial call.

unnormalised: According to officials, the fire originated on the 3rd floor, specifically in Flat No. 305. Residents of the affected building were evacuated as a precautionary measure. Several individuals residing in the nearby House No. C-27, Sector 44, also evacuated their homes.
normalised: According to officials, the fire originated on the third floor, specifically in Flat Number three zero five. Residents of the affected building were evacuated as a precautionary measure. Several individuals residing in the nearby House Number C-twenty seven, Sector forty four, also evacuated their homes.

unnormalised: "We received a call at approximately 3:10 AM regarding a fire at the mentioned address," stated Fire Officer Rajesh Kumar. "Our teams were able to contain the blaze within 2 hours, preventing it from spreading to adjacent buildings."
normalised: "We received a call at approximately three ten A-M regarding a fire at the mentioned address," stated Fire Officer Rajesh Kumar. "Our teams were able to contain the blaze within two hours, preventing it from spreading to adjacent buildings."

unnormalised: While there were no reported fatalities, two residents from Flat No. 305 sustained minor injuries and were immediately taken to the nearby Kailash Hospital, Sector 27. The cause of the fire is still under investigation, and authorities are urging residents to ensure regular maintenance of electrical wiring in their homes.
normalised: While there were no reported fatalities, two residents from Flat Number three zero five sustained minor injuries and were immediately taken to the nearby Kailash Hospital, Sector twenty seven. The cause of the fire is still under investigation, and authorities are urging residents to ensure regular maintenance of electrical wiring in their homes.
